critique: This document is an executive order amending a previous executive order to include additional members in the War Manpower Commission. It is difficult to assess the ideological tilt, immigration approach, national security vs. civil liberties, economic regulation, and social inclusion based on this document alone, as it primarily deals with administrative organization during wartime. The executive power is slightly expanded as it modifies an existing order. The federalism aspect is neutral as it doesn't significantly shift power between state and federal governments.
